div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1506 Qasr Naba, between Zahle and Baal- (846) bek, Coelesyria, 1902 Burial: c. 332 B.C. (Naster) Contents: 40 AR Alexander III: 1 tetradr.; 1 ob. Byblus: 2 1/16-shekels Sidon: 9 double-shekels; 26 1/16 shekels Tyre: 1 1/24-shekel Disposition: Formerly Rouvier coll. 32 Rouvier, RN 1902, pp. 258-9 Schlumberger, L'argent grec, p. 10, no. 20 Naster, INCJ, pp. 5, 10 ff.
